text:
[G.O. (D) No. 72, Highways and Minor Ports (EAP1) 21st March 2020, பங்குனி 8, விகாரி, திருவள்ளுவர் ஆண்டு-2051.]
No. II(2)/HWMP/216(d-2)/2020.
The Governor of Tamil Nadu having been satisfied that the lands specified in the Schedule below have to be acquired for the Highways purpose to wit for the formation of two laning extension of Thuraiyur-Perambalur Road SH-142 from Km 5/850 to 9/300 Km V.No.49 Nagalapuram Village, in Thuraiyur Taluk, Thiruchirappali District and it has already been decided that the entire amount of compensation to be awarded for the lands is to be paid out of the funds controlled or managed by the Divisional Engineer (H), Chennai Kanyakumari Industrial Corridor Project, Salem after considering the cause shown by the owner (or) other person having interest on such lands as the case may be do hereby publish the following notice under sub-section (1) of Section 15 of the Tamil Nadu Highways Act, 2001 (Tamil Nadu Act 34 of 2002).

NOTICE
Under sub-section (1) of Section 15 of the Tamil Nadu Highways Act, 2001 (Tamil Nadu Act 34 of 2002), the Governor of Tamil Nadu hereby acquires the land specified in the Schedule below measuring to an extent of 1997 sq.mts of dry lands in V.No.49 Nagalapuram Village in Thuraiyur Taluk, Thiruchirappali District for the purpose to wit for the formation of two laning extension of Thuraiyur-Permbalur Road SH-142 from Km 5/850 to 9/300 Km.
The Plan of the lands is kept in the Office of the Special Distirct Revenue Officer(L.A) Chennai Kanyakumari Industrial Corridor Project, Salem and in the Office of the Special Tahisildar (L.A) Chennai Kanyakumari Industrial Corridor Project, Perambalur and may be inspected at any time during office hours.
